detaileddescription.para: MPU Region Base Address Register Value

parameterdescription.para: The region to be configured, number 0 to 15.
The base address for the region.

memberdef.name: ARM_MPU_RASR
memberdef.initializer: ((((DisableExec ) << MPU_RASR_XN_Pos) & MPU_RASR_XN_Msk) | \ (((AccessPermission) << MPU_RASR_AP_Pos) & MPU_RASR_AP_Msk) | \ (((TypeExtField ) << MPU_RASR_TEX_Pos) & MPU_RASR_TEX_Msk) | \ (((IsShareable ) << MPU_RASR_S_Pos) & MPU_RASR_S_Msk) | \ (((IsCacheable ) << MPU_RASR_C_Pos) & MPU_RASR_C_Msk) | \ (((IsBufferable ) << MPU_RASR_B_Pos) & MPU_RASR_B_Msk) | \ (((SubRegionDisable) << MPU_RASR_SRD_Pos) & MPU_RASR_SRD_Msk) | \ (((Size ) << MPU_RASR_SIZE_Pos) & MPU_RASR_SIZE_Msk) | \ (MPU_RASR_ENABLE_Msk))

detaileddescription.para: MPU Region Attribute and Size Register Value

parameterdescription.para: Instruction access disable bit, 1= disable instruction fetches.
Data access permissions, allows you to configure read/write access for User and Privileged mode.
Type extension field, allows you to configure memory access type, for example strongly ordered, peripheral.
Region is shareable between multiple bus masters.
Region is cacheable, i.e. its value may be kept in cache.
Region is bufferable, i.e. using write-back caching. Cacheable but non-bufferable regions use write-through policy.
Region size of the region to be configured, for example 4K, 8K.

detaileddescription.para:
Enable the MPU.
MPU_Control
Default access permissions for unconfigured regions.

Clear and disable the given MPU region.
rnr
Region number to be cleared.

Configure an MPU region.
rbar
Value for RBAR register.
rsar
Value for RSAR register.

Configure the given MPU region.
rnr
Region number to be configured.
rbar
Value for RBAR register.
rsar
Value for RSAR register.

memberdef.argsstring: (volatile uint32_t *dst, const uint32_t *__RESTRICT src, uint32_t len)
memberdef.name: orderedCpy

detaileddescription.para:
Memcopy with strictly ordered memory access, e.g. for register targets.
dst
Destination data is copied to.
src
Source data is copied from.
len
Amount of data words to be copied.

Load the given number of MPU regions from a table.
table
Pointer to the MPU configuration table.
cnt
Amount of regions to be configured.
